did.abstract: Two handbills from an unknown newspaper relating to protests over a performance by Charles Mathews in New York City in 1834.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Source and date of acquisition unknown. Formally accessioned in 1977.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This small collection is housed in a single folder.

bioghist.head: Biographical note
bioghist.p: Charles Mathews (1776-1835) was a well-known British comedic actor who made two tours through the United States during his career.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Charles Mathews performance handbills, 1977.533, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Public Library, Center for Brooklyn History.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Minimally processed to the collection level. This collection was rehoused and the finding aid revised by Dee Bowers in 2023.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Two handbills from an unknown newspaper for a performance by Charles Mathews in New York City in 1834. One handbill is a notice for the public to protest the performance, while the other, issued by E. Simpson, argues against the first and urges the public to see the performance.
